page.title: 01GAZATEER
page.content: Our block is entirely farmland and lies to the west, just outside the town boundary of Cupar. The landscape consists of rounded hills, gentle slopes and fertile valleys or straths. Though field cropping is the main land cover the area is well endowed with woodland patches, hedgerows and areas of permanent meadow. This attractive landscape offers a wide range of habitats for a great variety of plant and animal life. Farming dominates the local economy though many farm cottages are now occupied by people who commute to work in neighbouring towns. Buildings vary from ruined castles to well preserved 19th century farm steadings to modern farm structures. Rural cottages are all in good repair, fully occupied with families who rely on Cupar as a main base for schooling and shopping.
